metadata.feature_description: Group similar activities together in the stream

steps.expected: Activity Feed page loads with activity stream
steps.actual: Activity Feed page loaded successfully showing user profile and activity stream posts

steps.action: Enter edit mode by clicking Edit icon in sidebar
steps.expected: Page enters edit mode showing module boundaries
steps.actual: Edit mode activated, module panes visible with Activity Stream module in LeftPane

steps.action: Navigate to Activity Stream module settings (Module ID 375)
steps.expected: Module settings page opens with tabs
steps.actual: Module settings page opened with tabs: Module Settings, Permissions, Page Settings, Activity Stream

steps.action: Click on Activity Stream tab to view feature-specific settings
steps.expected: Activity Stream settings panel displays with Enable Grouping of Posts option
steps.actual: Activity Stream tab displayed settings including 'Enable Grouping of Posts' checkbox which is currently checked (enabled)

steps.action: Verify Enable Grouping of Posts checkbox exists in Activity Stream settings
steps.expected: Checkbox for Enable Grouping of Posts is visible and accessible
steps.actual: Checkbox 'Enable Grouping of Posts:' is visible with a help icon, and is currently checked (enabled)

observations: Code review confirmed grouping functionality is implemented via EnableGrouping property in View.ascx.cs and GroupedJournalControl.ascx
The 'Enable Grouping of Posts' setting is located in Module Settings > Activity Stream tab
When enabled, activity stream posts of similar type will be grouped together as a single post (per Settings.ascx.resx help text)
GroupedJournalControl.ascx provides UI for viewing grouped activities with 'Load More' functionality
The Activity Feed currently shows individual posts - grouping may require similar activities from multiple users within a timeframe to trigger visual grouping
Initial server error (500.19) was encountered on first navigation due to IIS configuration issue with Windows Authentication, but was resolved by navigating directly to Default.aspx
